pullrequest.title: Allow comms client under a ROS namespace

content.raw:
I couldn't get this to work (I think). Here is my test scenario:

# In an `osrf/subt` catkin workspace
 
1. Terminal 1: `ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG3`
2. Terminal 2: `ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG3`

# In an `osrf/subt_seed -b test_ns` workspace

1. Terminal 3: `roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X1`
2. Terminal 4: `roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X2`

# Expected output

1. Terminal 3 should see a series of:

```
X1 sending hello X2
Got Message!
```

2. Terminal 4 should see a series of:

```
X2 sending hello X1
Got Message!
```

# Actual output

1. Terminal 3 shows no "Got Message!", just the "X1 sending hello to X2"
2. Terminal 4 shows no "Got Message!", just the "X2 sending hellow to X1"
content.html:
I couldn't get this to work (I think). Here is my test scenario:

In an osrf/subt catkin workspace

  1. Terminal 1: ign launch cloudsim_sim.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG3
  2. Terminal 2: ign launch cloudsim_bridge.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG3

In an osrf/subt_seed -b test_ns workspace

  1. Terminal 3: roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X1
  2. Terminal 4: roslaunch subt_seed x1.launch robot_name:=X2

Expected output

  1. Terminal 3 should see a series of:
X1 sending hello X2
Got Message!
  1. Terminal 4 should see a series of:
X2 sending hello X1
Got Message!

Actual output

  1. Terminal 3 shows no "Got Message!", just the "X1 sending hello to X2"
  2. Terminal 4 shows no "Got Message!", just the "X2 sending hellow to X1"

pullrequest.title: Allow comms client under a ROS namespace

content.raw: I made some changes in c323846 as [suggested](#!/osrf/subt/issues/143/subt-commsclient-cant-handle-ros#comment-53441264) by @{557058:ba6a5dd6-99be-45af-a802-687b3318965a} and it seems to fix the communication issue between X1 and X2, but now both of them have a problem calling the `pose_from_artifact_origin` service. This is the error I'm getting `Failed to call pose_from_artifact_origin service, robot may not exist, be outside staging area, or the service is not available.`
content.html: I made some changes in c323846 as suggested by @Reid Sawtell and it seems to fix the communication issue between X1 and X2, but now both of them have a problem calling the pose_from_artifact_origin service. This is the error I'm getting Failed to call pose_from_artifact_origin service, robot may not exist, be outside staging area, or the service is not available.

pullrequest.title: Allow comms client under a ROS namespace

content.raw: I am getting the same error without this PR. I think there's is a deadlock in the `subt_ros_relay` node that occurs when two robots start sending messages to each other while at the same time try to call the `pose_from_artifact_origin` service.
content.html: I am getting the same error without this PR. I think there's is a deadlock in the subt_ros_relay node that occurs when two robots start sending messages to each other while at the same time try to call the pose_from_artifact_origin service.
